title: DWARAPALA
description:
Kediri, Jawa Timur
Abad ke-13-14 Masehi
No. Inv. 211a/3237

Arca penjaga yang ditempatkan di pintu gerbang bangunan suci atau tempat yang disucikan di masa Hindu-Buddha. Umumnya digambarkan berwujud raksasa yang membawa senjata gadha.

title: DWARAPALA
description:
Kediri, East Java
13th - 14th Century CE
No. Inv. 211a/3237

This guardian statue is placed at the entrance of sacred buildings or consecrated places from the Hindu- Buddhist era. Typically, it is depicted as a giant carrying a gadha (mace).

description:

title: MAKARA
description:
Soloksipin, Jambi, Sumatra
Abad 11 Masehi
No. Inv. 459d/4399

Makhluk mitologi Hindu, digambarkan gabungan antara gajah, buaya, dan ikan. Makara adalah kendaraan Dewa Baruna dan Dewi Gangga yang sering pula menghiasi candi Hindu-Buddha menjadi simbol kekuatan dan perlindungan.

title: MAKARA
description:
Soloksipin, Jambi, Sumatra
11th Century CE
No. Inv. 459d/4399

A Hindu mythological creature depicted as a hybrid of an elephant, crocodile, and fish. Makara is the vehicle of Lord Baruna and Goddess Gangga, often adorning Hindu- Buddhist temples as a symbol of strength and protection.

title: MAKARA
description:

title: NANDI
description:
Klaten, Ngupit, Jawa Tengah
Abad ke-9 Masehi
No. Inv. 322c/4317

Wahana (kendaraan) Dewa Śiwa berbentuk lembu jantan, simbol loyalitas, maskulinitas dan kekuatan fisik. Nandi menyimbolkan loyalitas, ketulusan, dan penjaga kesucian.

title: NANDI
description:
Klaten, Ngupit, Central Java
9th Century CE
No. Inv. 322c/4317

Nandi, the vehicle of the Śiva, is depicted as a bull, symbolising loyalty, masculinity, and physical strength. Nandi represents loyalty, sincerity, and serves as a guardian of purity.
